metadata.feature_description: Generate RSS feed for activity stream content

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Generate RSS Feed for Activity Stream

steps.action: Navigated to Activity Feed page to locate RSS feed functionality
steps.expected: Activity Feed page should load with Activity Stream module displaying posts and an RSS feed link/icon
steps.actual: Activity Feed page loaded successfully showing activity stream with multiple posts (wiki articles, badges, user actions) and an RSS feed link at the bottom of the stream area

steps.action: Accessed RSS feed URL (Activity-Feed/view/rssfeed) to generate RSS feed
steps.expected: RSS feed should be generated in valid RSS 2.0 XML format with activity stream content
steps.actual: RSS 2.0 XML feed successfully generated containing: title 'My Website Most recent journals', proper namespaces (xmlns:journal, xmlns:slash), language 'en-US', pubDate/lastBuildDate timestamps, generator info 'Journal RSS Generator Version 10.1.1.87', and multiple item elements with activity stream posts including titles, descriptions, authors, comments links, and publication dates

observations: The RSS feed link uses the class 'journal-social-rss' and opens in a new tab (target='_blank') when clicked from the UI
RSS feed supports query parameters: groupid, journalid, pagesize, journaltypeid, includebody for filtering content
The feed properly handles various content types including emojis, special characters, and HTML content in descriptions
Some activity items show empty link tags due to anonymous/system-generated posts without direct URLs
